‚Ä¢ You are a reliable team player, self-starter, ambitious, and collaborate well with EAs and other colleagues at all levels
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree preferred

title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
JOB SUMMARY: The Human Resources Assistant is responsible for assisting in planning, coordinating, developing, organizing, implementing, evaluating, interpreting, directing and administering the day to day human resources functions for the community in accordance with established policies and procedures.

Querencia at Barton Creek...

2500 Barton Creek Blvd.

Austin, TX 78735

ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions:

Interface with team members and answer questions relating to human resources issues; forward unresolved issues to appropriate party.

Coordinate pre-employment activities: posting and reviewing applicants, scheduling interviews, assessments, reference and background checks, drug testing, etc.

Assist with the onboarding and termination process for team members.

Prepare, organize, secure, scan, file and maintain all human resource reports, general correspondence, legal documents, financial reports, team member personnel records, and other related documents.

Support and assist the director of human resources with projects as assigned.

Coordinate in planning and coordinating community trainings, orientation or activities.

Comply with applicable federal, state and local laws, rules, and regulations; maintains knowledge of and follows all company policies and procedures.

Obtain knowledge and demonstrate the principles of Living Lifespace , person directed care and successful aging philosophies and their inherent core values of commitment, respect, compassion, dedication, team work and quality. Team member will support, actively participate and act in accordance with the principles of the Living Lifespace service culture and be familiar with and fluent in the language and service pillars of Living Lifespace.

Maintain regular and punctual attendance at work and meetings.

OTHER DUTIES: Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the team member for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Position may require some outside travel.

During emergencies or natural disasters may be required to be on duty for the duration of the disaster.

JOB REQUIREMENTS:

High school diploma or equivalent. Associates degree highly preferred.

Prefer a minimum two (2) years office experience, preferably in human resources. Healthcare or hospitality experience helpful.

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED:

Knowledgeable in administrative practices and procedures, as well as laws, regulations and guidelines pertaining to Equal Employment Opportunity, Department of Labor regulations, labor relations, employee relations, benefit administration, workers compensation and OSHA.

Ability to plan, organize, develop, implement, and interpret programs, goals, objectives, policies and procedures at all levels.

Must have the ability to act as liaison between team members and management.

Solid organizational skills including attention to detail and multi-tasking skills.

Must be able to function efficiently despite distractions and interruptions.

Ability to read, write and speak English sufficient to perform job duties and to interact and communicate with residents, vendors and team members.

ENVIRONMENTAL AND PHYSICAL ACTIVITY REQUIREMENTS: The physical activities of this position constantly require effective talking, hearing, sitting, walking and standing functions. The position also often involves sedentary work where sitting is required most of the time, with occasional standing or walking. The position also is often requires exerting up to 10 pounds of force occasionally and/or negligible amount of force frequently or constantly to lift, carry, push, pull or otherwise move objects, including the human body. Must be able to perform activities with close visual acuity, such as reading a computer screen and reading print material. The functions of this position are conducted in a temperature controlled environment.

INTELLECTUAL/EMOTIONAL REQUIREMENTS: The occupant of this position must be able to perform the responsibilities of the position well under pressure. The position requires adaptability to performing a variety of duties, often changing from one task to another without loss of efficiency or composure. This position requires the ability to deal with and find resolution to problems and maintain a productive working relationship with team members, and may be interrupted frequently to meet the needs and requests of others. It also requires adaptability to fluctuate between priorities on a daily basis while being responsive to needs as they arise

description:

title: Human Resources Generalist
description:
Full Time HR Generalist - Belmont Village Senior Living West Lake Hills

A Life Changing Career That Changes More Than One Life... Belmont Village Senior Living communities are known across the nation for our high standard of operating, exceptional care, award winning programming, and supportive employee culture. As the HR Generalist, you will be an integral part of the management team who... ensures these standards are maintained. In this on-site role you will support approximately 100-130 hourly, entry-level employees with the support of the Regional Director of Human Resources and a corporate human resources department.

OUR COMMITMENT TO YOU
‚Ä¢ A supportive culture led by seasoned Regional & Corporate teams
‚Ä¢ Well established employee training & development programs
‚Ä¢ HR Technology platforms to assist in employee engagement, recruitment & compliance.

POSITION SUMMARY

As the HR Generalist, you will be the on-site HR professional in a fast paced and rapidly changing environment. You will work closely with other department managers, front line employees and a Regional HR Director. Your responsibilities will include payroll, full cycle recruitment, employee relations, workers compensation, ensuring consistent compliance of personnel policies, & meeting regulatory compliance standards in addition to various administrative functions.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS
‚Ä¢ Serves as a link between management & employees with employee relations related topics and interpretation of policies & procedures.
‚Ä¢ Manages the full cycle recruitment process including use of a recruitment management system, candidate sourcing, screening, interviewing and orientation working collaboratively with other managers.
‚Ä¢ Maintains personnel records and ensures compliance.
‚Ä¢ Manages training records through the electronic Learning Management System.
‚Ä¢ Manages Concierge services to ensure customer satisfaction through prompt delivery of a high standard of customer service.
‚Ä¢ Manages a Staffing Coordinator who assists with recruitment and HR administrative functions.

REQUIREMENTS
‚Ä¢ Must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and the flu
‚Ä¢ Prior supervisory experience.
‚Ä¢ Minimum of 3 years of comparable Human Resources Generalist experience
‚Ä¢ Effective organizational, communication and problem-solving skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to maintain confidentiality
‚Ä¢ Interest in working with senior population
‚Ä¢ Bachelors degree in Human Resources or related field strongly preferred

WE CARE ABOUT YOU!

Belmont Village Senior Living offers full-time management employees benefit plans including medical, dental, vision, prescription, paid vacation, paid holidays, paid personal days, 401(k) savings with employer match, bonus opportunities, short-term disability, long-term disability, & life insurance

title: HR Administrator
description:
The video games industry represents the pinnacle of interactive digital content. At Keywords, we are using our passion for games, technology and media to create a global services platform for video games and beyond. We aim to become the ‚Äúgo-to‚Äù provider of technical services. By working as their external development partner, we enable leading content creators and publishers to leverage our... expertise and capacity across the lifecycle of interactive content. In doing so, we enable our clients who are operating in complex and fast-moving environments to remain lean and agile, and to focus on creating and monetizing the most engaging experiences. We are trusted and relied upon by many of the world‚Äôs leading video game companies to work alongside them during concept, development and live operations by leveraging the breadth and depth of our industry leading service lines every step of the way.

Hybrid-Remote:

This role is primarily remote work from home, however, this person will need to go into our office on occasion as needed.

POSITION SUMMARY:

The HR Assistant will be responsible for a range of administrative tasks on the HR team including maintaining employee files, processing new hire and termination paperwork, and preparing presentation and training materials

Reporting to the Regional HR Director, the HR Assistant will work closely with all members of the HR Team on tasks related to onboarding/offboarding, compliance, training & development, and compensation

JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:

This is not an exhaustive list of functions, responsibilities may vary dependent on the need of the role and changing business environment.
‚Ä¢ Maintains accurate and up-to-date human resource files, records, and documentation.
‚Ä¢ Oversee the completion of employee compensation and benefit information including; benefits, personnel transactions such as hires, promotions, transfers.
‚Ä¢ Assist operations with administrative tasks as assigned that help properties ensure efficient operations.
‚Ä¢ Conduct or assist with employee exit interviews
‚Ä¢ Manage the HR inbox of daily queries to ensure timely responses.
‚Ä¢ Support and participate in HR projects, volunteer activities, and other HR admin duties
‚Ä¢ Prepare and process documentation related to employee movement such as regularization, transfer, promotion, etc.
‚Ä¢ Assist with payroll functions by ensuring completeness and accuracy of employee-relevant data.
‚Ä¢ Acts as a liaison and coordinate with government agencies and external benefits vendor, which include health, insurance plan providers etc.
‚Ä¢ Assist and process employee mandated benefits such as sickness, maternity benefits etc.
‚Ä¢ Performs periodic audits of HR files and records to ensure that all required documents are collected and filed appropriately.
‚Ä¢ Conducts or assists with new hire onboarding and orientation.
‚Ä¢ Deal with employee requests and inquiries relative to standard policies, compensation and benefits, etc.
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with i-9 guidelines
‚Ä¢ Maintains the integrity and confidentiality of human resource files and records.
‚Ä¢ Performs duties as required.
‚Ä¢ 1-2 years of HR generalist experience, including employee relations, employment law, HR administration, Compensation and Benefits.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge, skills and abilities in employee relations, psychology, and conflict management.
‚Ä¢ Highly computer literate with capability in email, MS Office and related business and communication tools.
‚Ä¢ Fantastic organizational and management skills.
‚Ä¢ Effective HR administration and people management skills.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication abilities including presentation/facilitation and delivery skills.
‚Ä¢ Associates degree in human resources or related (essential).
‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental, Vision benefits
‚Ä¢ Voluntary Long-term / Short-term Disability
‚Ä¢ 401K w/ company match
‚Ä¢ Work alongside dynamic individuals in the gaming industry
‚Ä¢ Work within a company with upward career growth opportunities

PRIVACY POLICY

Keywords Studios is strongly committed to protecting your personal information. By sending your CV/Resume, you are agreeing to our terms and conditions and acknowledge that your data will be managed in accordance with our privacy policy (https://www.keywordsstudios.com/privacy-policy).

title: Human Resources Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Description

Human Resources Administrative Assistant...

The SAFE Alliance Human Resources team seeks a full-time administrative assistant. The HR team at SAFE manages the recruitment, hiring, onboarding, compliance, benefits, and training processes for all staff at SAFE, and strives to maintain an organized, productive, healthy, and engaging environment for everyone in the organization.

About SAFE:
‚Ä¢ SAFE‚Äôs mission is our name: Stop Abuse For Everyone. We achieve our mission by acknowledging and responding to the intersection of child abuse, sexual assault, human trafficking, and domestic violence.
‚Ä¢ The SAFE Alliance grew out of the courageous work of the Center for Battered Women, the Austin Rape Crisis Center, and the Austin Children‚Äôs Shelter, all respected, women-led human service agencies created by volunteers and informed by survivors who needed support, safety and justice.
‚Ä¢ With over 20 programs and 400 staff, we have been serving the Austin community and beyond for over 30 years.
‚Ä¢ The SAFE Alliance strongly encourages members of traditionally underrepresented communities to apply, including: Black, Indigenous, and people of color; LGBTQ+ identified people; gender-nonconforming people; individuals with disabilities; veterans; and people who speak a language in addition to English.

About this position:
‚Ä¢ We need you to fill the role of Human Resources Administrative Assistant. This is a FULL TIME, NON-EXEMPT position at our Rathgeber Village Campus. Due to COVID-19 precautions, this position will be partially working remotely, with the expectation that you are able to come to the office on a weekly basis to perform in-person duties. We will pay you a salary of $20/hour.

Key Duties:
‚Ä¢ Provide clerical support for the Chief Human Resources Officer.
‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate and up-to-date human resource files, records, and documentation.
‚Ä¢ Maintain employee information by entering and updating employment and status-change data in the human resources information system.
‚Ä¢ Coordinate HR projects (meetings, training, surveys etc.) and take minutes.
‚Ä¢ Assist with New Employee Orientation preparation and facilitation, as needed
‚Ä¢ Answer employees‚Äô questions and provide requested information.
‚Ä¢ Answer telephone calls and provide needed information.
‚Ä¢ Maintain schedule and coordinate calendar activities.
‚Ä¢ Create reports for senior management.
‚Ä¢ Prepare job offers and on-boarding for interns/staff.
‚Ä¢ Process background checks for interns and employment verifications for staff.
‚Ä¢ Perform periodic audits of HR files and records to ensure that all required documents are collected and filed appropriately.
‚Ä¢ Process I-9‚Äôs through E-verify
‚Ä¢ Update Human Resources section of the organization‚Äôs intranet
‚Ä¢ Order supplies and process invoices for payment
‚Ä¢ Reconcile credit card receipts and credit card logs
‚Ä¢ Maintain the integrity and confidentiality of human resource files and records.

Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Possess a High School Diploma or GED; Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Psychology or related field preferred; plus
‚Ä¢ One year of relevant Human Resources experience and
‚Ä¢ Three years‚Äô experience in a fast-paced, high-demand administrative role
‚Ä¢ Any equivalent combination of education and experience.
‚Ä¢ Excellent Verbal and written communication Skills
‚Ä¢ Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to manage sensitive and confidential situations with tact, professionalism, and diplomacy.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
‚Ä¢ Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite
‚Ä¢ Proficient with or the ability to quickly learn payroll management, human resource information system (HRIS), and similar computer applications.
‚Ä¢ Pass all required criminal history background checks; have a valid Texas driver‚Äôs license and provide Department of Public Safety proof of driving record acceptable to agency insurers for the past three years; and must submit to pre-employment drug screen and TB text as well as random drug screens when directed.

About our benefits:
‚Ä¢ Full-time employees receive employer paid health insurance, short-term disability, and life insurance. *
‚Ä¢ Optional dental, vision and pet insurance. *
‚Ä¢ 403(b) retirement plan with an employer match, and 15 days of Paid Time Off (PTO), 4 Personal Holidays, 7 Paid holidays, and more*
‚Ä¢ We‚Äôll provide you with an amazing work environment where you‚Äôll get to make a difference every day.
‚Ä¢ Benefits are prorated based on date of hire and hours worked. Eligibility is dependent upon FTE, status, etc.

title: Marketing Data Analyst
description:
Overview:
Two Barrels is hiring a Marketing Analyst for $70,000/year. You will be a traditional company employee. This is a full time 40 hour M-F position with company benefits. This is a remote position. Our main office is in Spokane WA, and we have satellite offices in Austin TX and Salt Lake City UT.
As a Marketing Analyst at Two Barrels, you will work closely with our Creative Director and... Website Foreman to help determine where to focus our marketing efforts. The Marketing Analyst will need to be comfortable diving into a huuuuge amount of data that has gone relatively untapped until now. In this role you will be expected to ask questions, understand the whys and offer solutions.
Location:
Remote | Spokane - Austin - SLC |
Duration:
Full Time
Wage:
$70,000/year
Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Develop and streamline necessary dashboards and one-off analyses, providing ability to surface business-critical KPIs, monitor the health of marketing channels and effectively communicate performance.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with stakeholders to develop and refine queries and acquire data necessary to answer them.
‚Ä¢ Convert data into insights including implications and recommendations that are specific and actionable for the Marketing team and across the business.
‚Ä¢ Partner with other analysts as well as data engineering and technology teams to support data infrastructure projects.
‚Ä¢ Work with stakeholders to identify key metrics used to evaluate marketing performance.
‚Ä¢ Use customer centric data analysis, data visualization, segmentation and a/b testing to optimize across channels and within campaigns.
‚Ä¢ Stay current on best practice in Marketing Analytics methodologies and trends.
‚Ä¢ Any position that is required to work in office regularly or on occasion must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for the job unless state law prohibits employers from requiring vaccines.

Minimum Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's (BA or BS) in business, computer science, or related field.
‚Ä¢ 3 years of experience in marketing analytics using Postgres, SQL, mysql, mariadb, or aurora db.
‚Ä¢ Ability to join data from multiple datasets.
‚Ä¢ In-depth experience in creating and documenting detailed requirements for marketing processes.
‚Ä¢ Ability to analyze and provide actionable marketing recommendations.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational, interpersonal and customer centric approaches.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated fluency in tools like Excel, PowerPoint, Lucid Chart, JIRA and Confluence.

Why you might like this job:
You are eager to ask questions and find out the "why".
You want to be a part of a team making waves in their industry.
You are motivated by KPI performance improvement.
You're tired of being on a huge team.
You want your work to have a long-term, meaningful purpose.
Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Great Wage
‚Ä¢ WFH comfort package
‚Ä¢ 22 days paid time off (29 days after 3 years. Flexible time off after 5 years!)
‚Ä¢ 4% retirement matching through a Charles Schwab 401(k)
‚Ä¢ 100% employer-paid medical, dental and vision for employees
‚Ä¢ Maternity and Paternity Leave
‚Ä¢ Flexible hours
‚Ä¢ Coffee shop next door
‚Ä¢ Crappy parking? Oh, I mean a cool downtown location for easy public transportation options

title: Card Present API Data Analyst
description:
Company Description

Visa is a world leader in digital payments, facilitating more than 215 billion payments transactions between consumers, merchants, financial institutions and government entities across more than 200 countries and territories each year. Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable and secure payments network, enabling individuals... businesses and economies to thrive.

When you join Visa, you join a culture of purpose and belonging ‚Äì where your growth is priority, your identity is embraced, and the work you do matters. We believe that economies that include everyone everywhere, uplift everyone everywhere. Your work will have a direct impact on billions of people around the world ‚Äì helping unlock financial access to enable the future of money movement.

Join Visa: A Network Working for Everyone.

Job Description

We are seeking a talented Point of Sale Product Support Engineer with superb technical experience and customer facing skills. The position will provide technical certification and developmental support to point-of-sale API messages for product providers and payment gateways. The Product Support Engineer will be responsible for meeting operational goals, driving issue resolution and exceeding customer expectations. The position will be based at Visa‚Äôs offices in Austin, TX.

¬∑ Perform technology partner card present/EMV payment transaction field level validation/testing for assigned projects to ensure data format accuracy per the relevant specifications and defined scope during the certification process.

¬∑ Conduct project scoping, test script customization/distribution for assigned message level validation projects.

¬∑ Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve moderately complex processing, application usage, or business issues during the message level validation/testing process.

¬∑ Interface with internal Regional/Product/System‚Äôs Architect teams and POS technology partners to provide excellent customer relations/support during the certification process.

¬∑ Identify, document and communicate testing/validation results to Regional and POS technology partners. Perform re-tests and regression testing as necessary through the validation/testing process.

¬∑ Generate weekly reports for regional, product and executive teams for all assigned projects to provide a high-level overview of project timelines, certification status, risks and identified issues/blockers.

¬∑ Escalate issues to internal Regional, Systems Architect, Product Development, Product Management, and/or Operations teams and manage issue resolution.

¬∑ Perform network/system diagnostics and transaction research to analyze and resolve endpoint problems in both the test and production environment.

¬∑ Communicate, monitor, and escalate known issues/tickets through resolution.

¬∑ Build internal support-related tools documentation and create/edit/distribute customer communications.

¬∑ Support EMV Level 3 device phase of validation for all supported card brands utilizing the associated test platforms.

¬∑ Handle multiple assignments, appropriately prioritize work, and provide excellent written and verbal communication

This is a hybrid position. Hybrid employees can alternate time between both remote and office. Employees in hybrid roles are expected to work from the office two days a week, Tuesdays and Wednesdays with a general guidepost of being in the office 50% of the time based on business needs.

Qualifications

Basic Qualifications:
¬∑ 2+ years of related work experience or a bachelor‚Äôs degree or an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) in Computer Science, MIS, EE, CE.

Preferred Qualifications:
¬∑ 3 or more years of work experience with a Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or more than 2 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD)
¬∑ 3+ years of experience with card present payment or point-of-sale transaction technologies
¬∑ 2+ years of experience with the REST API in the payments industry.
¬∑ 2+ years of experience with QA, certification, L3 support including practical experience with at least one accredited EMV test tool/host simulator.
¬∑ 2+ years of in-depth technical experience such as Tier 3 technical support.
¬∑ Strong teamwork skills and excellent collaboration skills with the ability to collaborate with inter-disciplinary groups.
¬∑ Strong written/verbal communication and excellent problems solving skills.
¬∑ Self-driven, flexible and self-motivated.

Additional Information

Visa has adopted a COVID-19 vaccination policy to safeguard the health and well-being of our employees and visitors. As a condition of employment, all employees based in the U.S. are required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19, unless a reasonable accommodation is approved or as otherwise required by law.

Work Hours: Varies upon the needs of the department.

Travel Requirements: This position requires the incumbent to travel for work 10% of the time.

Mental/Physical Requirements: This position will be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, reach with hands and arms, and bend or lift up to 25 pounds.

Visa is an EEO Employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or protected veteran status. Visa will also consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with EEOC guidelines and applicable local law.

Visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable local law, including the requirements of Article 49 of the San Francisco Police Code

title: Data Analyst
description:
At Pearson, we‚Äôre committed to a world that‚Äôs always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who push the boundaries of technology. We create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world‚Äôs innovations. Within the Pearson Virtual Schools (PVS) division we have reimagined K-12 education through our virtual school and... curriculum offerings. Our schools, Connections Academy and Pearson Online Academy, provide a best-in-class online learning environment for K-12 students to acquire the skills and confidence they need to adapt and thrive in a changing world. We also support school districts with curriculum, teachers, and technology as they make the shift to online. The COVID-19 pandemic introduced significant disruption and transformation to the K-12 learning market. And as a result, our category has seen explosive growth and our business has experienced enormous increases in awareness and enrollments. This presents an incredible opportunity for our team to chart a ground-breaking path through this shifting environment to achieve continued success.

Job Overview

The Data Analyst directly supports the Enrollment & Customer Engagement department, located within Pearson Virtual Schools division, in which you will focus on producing and maintaining both ad-hoc analysis and the day-to-day reporting. This includes collaborating with internal partners to mine and analyze quantitative and qualitative workforce and operational data to generate reports and reveal insights that lead to great operational decisions.

Data Exploration
‚Ä¢ Supports in exploring data within one to two files to determine trends and relationships between variables
‚Ä¢ Assist with qualitative strategic projects by conducting independent research and collaborating with internal stakeholders
‚Ä¢ Mine and analyze large datasets, draw valid inferences, and present findings to leaders across Enrollment Experience and Customer Engagement teams.
‚Ä¢ Organizing and transforming information into comprehensible structures
‚Ä¢ Using tools and techniques to visualize data in easy-to-understand formats, such as diagrams and graphs
‚Ä¢ Communicating with stakeholders to understand data content and business requirements
‚Ä¢ Determine how critical data and KPIs are addressed in new systems or feature development and build analytics requirements into core systems to ensure comprehensive metrics are supported
‚Ä¢ Gathers operational data from various cross functional stakeholders to examine past business performance.
‚Ä¢ Identifies data patterns & trends, and provides insights to enhance business decision making capability in business planning, process improvement, solution assessment etc.

Reporting
‚Ä¢ Creates basic to sophisticated ad hoc report requests: Uses insights from data exploration to prepare basic visualizations and PowerPoint reports for clients requesting the data
‚Ä¢ Provide documentation and write business requirements to assist with the automation of reporting and data tools for quality, enrollment, & customer engagement teams.
‚Ä¢ Processing reports across multiple internal teams
‚Ä¢ Works with more senior staff to reach out to client to clarify asks, debrief with client to explain data insights, and confirm report
‚Ä¢ Contributes to periodic audits of data within business systems/platforms
‚Ä¢ Works with Analytics organization to ensure data quality and accuracy
‚Ä¢ Downloads required data and creates pre-defined reports as per defined schedule
‚Ä¢ Sends out reports to stakeholder group and answers basic questions pertaining to the report

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree or equivalent in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, Finance, & Quantitative Psychology, or Applied Research
‚Ä¢ 6+ years related experience in qualitative/quantitative analysis, reporting, ad hoc analysis
‚Ä¢ Experience with Tableau/Power BI
‚Ä¢ Intermediate to advanced expertise in SQL
‚Ä¢ Experience with Python and Java Script a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with or willingness to learn qualitative analysis software (e.g., NVIVO)
‚Ä¢ Experience working with disparate data sets, data mining, data/text visualization tools, and creation of dashboards
‚Ä¢ Experience working within CRMs specifically SalesForce
‚Ä¢ Expert knowledge in MS Office suite ‚Äì specifically within Excel with Macros and advance formulas
‚Ä¢ Must have strong analytical, reporting skills & strong Excel skills, such as the ability to create macros
‚Ä¢ Basic knowledge or interest about apps support procedures, concepts and other technical areas.
‚Ä¢ Strong oral, written and interpersonal communication skills, must be capable of telling a story that is based on complex data/information to others.
‚Ä¢ Recommend solutions to improve performance based on analysis
‚Ä¢ Must have excellent organizational and time management skills
‚Ä¢ Ability and willingness to learn new technologies and methodologies.

Learning is the most powerful force for change in the world. More than 20,000 Pearson employees deliver our products and services in nearly 200 countries, all working towards a common purpose ‚Äì to help everyone achieve their potential through learning. We do that by providing high quality, digital content and learning experiences, as well as assessments and qualifications that help people build their skills and grow with the world around them. We are the world‚Äôs leading learning company. Learn more at pearsonplc.com.

Pearson believes that wherever learning flourishes, so do people. We are committed to being an anti-racist‚ÄØcompany in everything we do. We value the power of an inclusive culture and a strong sense of belonging. We promote a culture where differences are embraced, opportunities are accessible, consideration and respect are the norm, and all individuals are supported in reaching their full potential. Through our talent, we believe that diversity, equity, and inclusion make us a more innovative and vibrant place to work. People are at the center, and we are committed to a sustainable environment and workplace where talent can learn, grow, and thrive. ‚ÄØ

To learn more about Pearson‚Äôs commitment to a diverse and inclusive workforce, please click here:‚ÄØ http://www.pearson.com/careers/diversity-and-inclusion.html ‚ÄØ

Pearson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and a member of E-Verify. We are committed to building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.‚ÄØAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other group protected by law.

Job: RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT

Organization: Virtual Learning

Schedule: FULL_TIME

Req ID: 679

title: Data Analyst - (Remote - US)
description:
Description

Mediavine is seeking a Data Analyst to join our Engineering team. We are looking for someone who enjoys solving interesting problems and wants to work with a small team of talented engineers on a product used by thousands of publishers. Applicants must be based in the United States...

About Mediavine

Mediavine is a fast-growing advertising management company representing over 8,000 websites in the food, lifestyle, DIY, and entertainment space. Founded by content creators, for content creators, Mediavine is a Top 20 Comscore property, exclusively reaching over 125 million monthly unique visitors. With best-in-class technology and a commitment to traffic quality and brand safety, we ensure optimal performance for our creators.

Mission & Culture

We help content creators build sustainable businesses. From educational tools and cutting-edge plugins to ad technology that maximizes earnings without slowing down your site, our motivation is ensuring your brand and business grow in every respect.

We are striving to build an inclusive and diverse team of highly talented individuals that reflects the industries we serve and the world we live in. We are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels welcomed. We are looking for individuals that will challenge us to continuously evolve and make Mediavine the employer of choice for people of all backgrounds. We strongly encourage minorities and individuals from underrepresented groups in technology to apply for this position.

Diversity and inclusion aren't platitudes to us; we take them seriously. Have a look at our team and read through our blog posts to learn more about our values and to discover if Mediavine is the place for you!

Position Title & Overview

The Data & Analytics team consists of data analysts, data engineers and analytics engineers working to build the most effective platform and tools to help uncover opportunities and make decisions with data here at Mediavine. We partner with Product, Support, Ad Operations and other teams within the Engineering department to understand behavior, develop accurate predictors and build solutions that provide the best internal and external experience possible.

The Data Analyst role will be assisting the analysts in their support of the business and helping to guide the direction through data based decisions. They will provide support in developing analytical processes and make use of data in meaningful ways that produce positive results.

Our current analytics toolkit consists of Tableau, Metabase and dbt running on top of a Snowflake data warehouse. We are exploring new BI tools and expect this position to add value in the implementation of this tool.

Essential Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with the product, support, engineering and ad ops to develop analytic monitoring and measurement tools that meet immediate needs
‚Ä¢ Develop self service tools that allow internal users to answer the next question beyond the initial ask
‚Ä¢ Assist on assigned projects through all phase
‚Ä¢ Increase the company‚Äôs analytical ability and comfort level through approachable analyses for non-analytical stakeholders and audience specific guidance
‚Ä¢ Create visualizations to monitor business performance and uncover interesting trends for investigation
‚Ä¢ Communicating requirements to the data engineering members of the team to make sure the platform can support the business needs
‚Ä¢ Lead anomaly investigation helping other teams identify root cause and present findings
‚Ä¢ Define and create exception based alerting that is meaningful for specific audiences along with investigation and remediation steps
‚Ä¢ Comfortably test and critique the process we use for exploratory data analysis and A/B testing. This includes helping stakeholders decide on testing strategy, generating baselines, approximating sample sizes and performing analysis of test results
‚Ä¢ Work with data engineers and analytics engineers to standardize transformation logic in the dbt layer for consistency and ease of exploration by end users
‚Ä¢ Adhere to data analysis code best practices and analysis standards

Requirements

Location:
‚Ä¢ Applicants must be based in the United States.

You Have
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in a data analyst role
‚Ä¢ Extremely strong SQL skills (CTEs, window functions, optimization)
‚Ä¢ Experience with one or more major BI tools (Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Comfortable working with multi-TB cloud data warehouses (Big Query, Snowflake, Redshift)
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of Ad Tech, Google Ad Manager and all of it‚Äôs fun quirks (so fun)

Nice To Haves
‚Ä¢ Experience with web analysis such as creating product funnels, user behavior, and paths
‚Ä¢ Experience with designing and analyzing experiments including but not limited to A/B testing
‚Ä¢ Experience with R or Python for creating data models or data manipulation
‚Ä¢ The ability to make your teammates laugh (it wouldn‚Äôt hurt if you were fun to work with is what I‚Äôm saying)
‚Ä¢ Familiarity with event tracking systems (NewRelic, Snowplow, etc)
‚Ä¢ Experience with dbt and Snowflake

Benefits
‚Ä¢ Remote work environment
‚Ä¢ Travel opportunities (remember those!?)
‚Ä¢ Comprehensive benefits including 401k, Health, Dental, and Vision insurance

title: Data Analyst
description:
Array is revolutionizing how businesses leverage and enhance consumer data. Our platform enables innovative companies and developers to seamlessly integrate credit and identity data into their apps, websites or workflows. As a remote-first company, we‚Äôre focused on providing opportunities for autonomous individuals to have high levels of impact at the forefront of the fintech space. Continuous... improvement, experimentation, and a clear mission stretch us individually and together in service of delivering the best products for our clients and users.

We are seeking detail-oriented, methodical, and collaborative data analysts to play a critical role in our organization and be part of our growing remote team. Your primary goal will be to leverage data and communicate your findings to help us make smarter, data-backed business decisions.

Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Translates business requirements from multiple business units to produce comprehensible data analytics and dashboards
‚Ä¢ Understanding how our business works and how this is reflected in our data
‚Ä¢ Collaborate closely with the product and engineering teams to develop and implement data queries, Python/SQL scripts to generate reports and spreadsheets of customer data
‚Ä¢ Create engaging visualizations that bring the data story to life
‚Ä¢ Assist with data quality, data cleansing, and metric reporting needs
‚Ä¢ Support the testing and reporting on new code and application usage
‚Ä¢ Works closely with Business Development and Data Engineering Teams

Job Requirements
‚Ä¢ 3+ years of experience in business analytics or data science preferred
‚Ä¢ 1+ years of experience in data exploration and data visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, Domo, etc. preferred
‚Ä¢ Advanced knowledge of SQL to extract or manipulate data is required
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Business Analytics or another relevant discipline
‚Ä¢ Experience working with business development teams to deliver data analytics and dashboards as needed.
‚Ä¢ Ability to multi-task and balance requirements from multiple groups across the business.
‚Ä¢ Understanding of end-user reporting concepts (date grains, dynamic grouping, filtering).
‚Ä¢ Good understanding of relational databases, and ability to leverage stored procedures, views and other DBMS features.
‚Ä¢ Ability to develop an understanding of table relationships by reverse engineering complex stored procedures.
‚Ä¢ Experience using Python/R for data analysis is a plus, but not required.

The ideal candidate is customer focused, results driven, innovative, works well on a team, and acts with integrity.What You Can Learn- Increase your business acumen- Facilitate cross-functional team reviews- Story-telling and framing skills- Learn to draw meaningful insights from data- Drive organization-wide actions based on findingsWho YouAre :- Must have advanced excel and powerpoint skills- Excellent written and verbal communication- Program Management experience- Proficiency in other visualization/analytics tools like Power BI / Tableau will be an added advantage- Understanding of finance and accounting standards will be an added advantageYou will also be responsible for the following:- Delivery of complex, high risk projects and maintaining project quality, finances and focus- Determine future reporting requirements and strategic needs aligned to organization/corporate strategy- Create and implement mid- level reporting strategy- Deliver results that change business behavior and improve capability- Collaborate with other teams and business groups- Assist in the financial planning process for a business unitHERE'S OUR STORY; NOW TELL US YOURSDell Technologies helps organizations and individuals build a brighter digital tomorrow.

title: Senior Accountant
description:
FLASH is seeking a Senior Accountant to perform and manage recurring daily, weekly, and monthly activities in a timely and accurate manner, ensuring appropriate financial controls and compliance with local GAAP. Reporting into the VP of Finance, this person will be detail oriented, dedicated and embrace the challenges a fast-growing organization brings.

What you'll do...
‚Ä¢ Review, enter, & monitor various general ledger transactions and journal entries to ensure timely entry, accurate accounting treatment, and compliance with applicable GAAP/IFRS
‚Ä¢ Assisting with accurate and timely review and analysis of financial statements/reports for both subsidiaries and at the corporate level.
‚Ä¢ Instruct and drive all balance sheet reconciliations, including various intercompany accounts to ensure they are easy to understand and audit. These reconciliations will be reviewed and signed off in a timely manner each month.
‚Ä¢ Oversee and manage all fixed assets including policy, tracking, depreciation, and applicable bank & lender correspondence.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with external firms for tax estimate calculations and payments.
‚Ä¢ Provide excellent customer service & collaboration with internal and external stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Identify, research, and advise the team regarding new and/or non-recurring transactions in accordance with GAAP/IFRS
‚Ä¢ Providing information to outside tax preparers, auditors, and state agencies to prepare annual and quarterly federal and state returns, and audits
‚Ä¢ Exhibit flexibility and a willingness to identify and take on new responsibilities and assignments.
‚Ä¢ Proactively identify and suggest recommendations for improving accounting processes, procedures, controls, and systems
‚Ä¢ Assist in the integration, mapping, and consolidation of subsidiaries and support future M&A initiatives as needed
‚Ä¢ Other duties and special projects as assigned

What we're looking for
‚Ä¢ Bachelors degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. MBA or CPA a plus.
‚Ä¢ 5+ years of related experience in a fast paced dynamic accounting environment
‚Ä¢ Experience in public accounting, software as a service, or manufacturing a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with NetSuite (or other similar ERP) a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience with Concur and/ or Salesforce a plus
‚Ä¢ Ability to be a great teammate
‚Ä¢ Great communication and interpersonal skills
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated ability to lead/assist others
‚Ä¢ Strong computer and analytical skills including proficiency in Excel and a proactive approach to learning new systems
‚Ä¢ Great organization and time-management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects

Essential duties and functions, pursuant to the Americans with Disabilities Act, may include the following. Other related duties may be assigned.

Maintains accounting ledgers by posting/reviewing and/or approving the posting of general ledger account transactions; ensuring transactions are processed in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ), City policy, applicable laws and regulations, and sound business practices. Provides coordination and oversees the collections of revenue and/or processing of customer payments; analysis, and clearing of delinquent accounts; notifying customers of insufficient payments; calculating/assessing delinquent fines/fees, etc. Prepares complex financial statements for external reporting or financial reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing general ledger account information and trends; applying advanced skills and knowledge of accounting and reporting requirements of GAAP . Provides guidance and direction through review of asset, liability, inventory, and/or capital account general ledger entries as prepared by internal/external department staff. Assists departments and other internal or external customers by providing procedural/financial and/or other information and guidance with automated or manual systems. title: Corporate Accountant
description:
Company Description

Snow‚Äôs mission is to stop organizations overpaying for the software they use, today and tomorrow. We help organizations optimize software availability, compliance and cost savings through delivery of on premise and cloud-based Software Asset Management solutions. Today we are the largest and most successful dedicated developer of SAM solutions with staff all over the world in... regional locations. To sustain our explosive growth, we are looking for the brightest, and most highly-skilled people who have their best work ahead of them. Now is the right time to join Snow.

Job Description

Reporting to our Corporate Accounting Manager, the Corporate Accountant will support all duties related to our Group financial close activities and consolidation process, as well as preparation of GAAP financial reporting to our debt holders and equity investors.

This position will prepare supporting schedules for Consolidated Balance Sheet reconciliations and support the preparation of our monthly Balance Sheet reviews. This includes ensuring global adherence to our group-wide accounting policies.

This position will also play a key role in the operation of our financial close internal control procedures.

Some key responsibilities include
‚Ä¢ Work closely with cross-functional teams on general ledger and consolidation related tasks
‚Ä¢ Prepare supporting schedules for Consolidated Balance Sheet reconciliations and support the preparation of our monthly Balance Sheet reviews
‚Ä¢ Ensure all controls, including SoX controls are properly performed for the consolidation and financial close processes
‚Ä¢ Evaluate and recommend process changes to improve controls and efficiency
‚Ä¢ Own the preparation of certain monthly corporate accounting tasks

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Accounting or Finance
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in general accounting
‚Ä¢ Strong Microsoft Excel skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to work independently on regular routine assignments, including managing time and meeting critical deadlines
‚Ä¢ Ability to perform work to a high degree of accuracy and attention to detail

Good to have
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act (SOX)
‚Ä¢ Strong work ethic and flexibility to work extended hours during critical periods such as quarter-end and year-end
‚Ä¢ Evaluate and recommend process changes to improve controls and efficiency

title: Content Strategist
description:
Job description:

Content Strategist - Senior - Multiple Position...

Client :- Charles Schwab & Co., Inc.

Client Location: - Austin, Texas (100% Remote )

Type: 12+-month contractor role with very high possibility of extension

12436016 Content Strategist - Senior (6-10 years) 100% remote opportunity - All submissions must contain work/portfolio samples sent to us in PDF format so thanks, in advance, for coordinating their delivery with all resume submissions. ** One or more of the samples should reflect multistep, interactive experiences.** Schwab User Experience Are you great at talking to clients and have experience working in Artificial Intelligence? We are looking for a Conversation Designer to join the Schwab Conversation Design team. Our ideal candidate is a highly creative individual with conversation design/VUI experience who is excited to build effective and engaging client experiences through multimodal conversational interfaces. This is an exciting opportunity to participate on the ground floor of a new and growing team at Schwab. What you'll do * Help lead the conversation strategy user experience and build alignment with a variety of stakeholders across the Schwab organization. * Participate in user testing and synthesize findings into delightful user experiences with research and UX Design partners. * Work together with User Experience Design to flesh out user experiences and provide copy support. * Create conversational workflows and strategies based on user feedback, research, and data. * Write multimodal conversations that support the Schwab brand and bring our "client first" values to life. * Work closely with the product and design teams to build exceptional user experiences through conversation design. * Deliver high-quality work in a fast-paced, always-changing environment while continually evolving product strategy. * Identify critical content issues and work with cross-functional partners to proactively drive improvements forward. * Champion customer-centric design with all teams and partners. Start

additional job details:

Job requirements What you have * 6+ years as a conversation designer, content strategist. * Candidates with a financial background are a plus. * Experience with voice and mobile interfaces. * Exceptional written and verbal communication as well as presentation and cross-functional negotiation skills. * Knowledge of accessibility, working in an Agile environment, JIRA, and UX design principles. * Ability to advocate for user experience and content strategy and facilitate alignment on content solutions with various partners (e.g., product, engineering, marketing, legal, risk, and compliance). * Expertise in the Microsoft Office suite and familiarity with Confluence and one or more design tools, such as Sketch, InVision, Voiceflow. * Ability to adhere to regulatory standards and requirements. * BA in a relevant field. Preferred skills: leadership of UX cross-functional teams, knowledge of accessibility, working in an Agile environment, and comfort with content workflow processes and delivery tools Information for recruiters. We put together these guidelines to help you recruit the best candidates for a content strategy role at Schwab. 1. The candidate should have at least 3 years of experience with the title Content Strategist, Product Content Strategist, Content Designer, Conversation Designer, UX Writer or similar. While roles as a marketer, social media strategist, writer, or editor may seem relevant, we're looking for someone who has additional skills. At Schwab, we look at things through our clients' eyes. Our Content Strategists promote a highly collaborative and inherently iterative approach so we design the right thing, design things right, and design something that works (i.e., something that can be developed and deployed in multiple environments, including mobile). To succeed at Schwab, Content Strategist candidates must have significant experience with user-centered design. They should know how to gather and integrate data and user feedback throughout the discovery, design, and post-launch cycles. 2. We want someone who can create multistep, interactive experiences. We typically design task-oriented experiences, such as buying or selling securities, transferring money, opening a new account, checking a routing number, or filling out forms. Throughout these experiences, users are entering information, selecting options, and making decisions. We want to see examples of this type of work in a Content Strategist's portfolio. Frequently, we see candidate portfolios focused on public site pages or advertising. These examples may demonstrate a candidate's writing skills, but they have limited value during our evaluation. 3. Financial services experience is a plus. It's not a requirement. Working at a big financial institution like Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Chase, E*Trade, or Fidelity is a good sign that a candidate will understand our business. With that said, we understand the value of new perspectives and welcome candidates with little or no financial services experience

title: Executive Assistant
description:
Rex is an ecosystem that incubates, launches and operates tech startups across a number of sectors at the intersection of technology and real estate: Services, FinTech, InsureTech, Data Services, and more. We are creating the Future of Real Estate by building and launching multiple tech companies committed to serving and empowering people everywhere.

We are launching synergistic tech startups... that will scale via real estate into numerous industries creating a flywheel effect where each launch strengthens the value of the network, increases the talent density, accelerates cross-pollination of ideas, and creates mutually beneficial corporate and technical infrastructure.

Review our initiatives page for more details on the current companies and our culture page to understand who we are.

Job Role Overview

We are looking to add an Executive Assistant to support multiple members of the executive team. Our executive team provides support to our startup ecosystem where this role will focus on supporting our startup launches leaders.

The EA is hard-edged and does not take no for an answer. The ideal candidate has a strong bias for action and is not reactive or passive. The EA has a passion for administrative excellence; is driven, adventurous, humorous, and flexible. The EA must enjoy handling a wide range of duties, including clerical tasks, research, scheduling, and relationship management activities. The position requires the highest level of integrity as there is significant exposure to confidential and sensitive information.

What you‚Äôll do:
‚Ä¢ Balancing and coordinating complex executive calendars and meeting arrangements.
‚Ä¢ Prep for meetings/calls, take notes on key action-items, and distribute follow up items.
‚Ä¢ Flexibility and willingness to contribute to Special Projects as needed.
‚Ä¢ Coordinating with our facilities team on team events, company socials, and demo day events.
‚Ä¢ Expense tracking and monthly report preparation.
‚Ä¢ Executing on a wide variety of open-ended directives.
‚Ä¢ Anticipating needs and issues before they arise.
‚Ä¢ Managing outside vendors and coordinating with other teammates to leverage individual capacity.

What you offer:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience in a fast-paced administrative role
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and organization
‚Ä¢ Experience with Google Suite (Gmail, Docs, Calendar), Slack and strong at asynchronous communication.
‚Ä¢ Proven track record of executing open-ended directives where discovery is needed up front.
‚Ä¢ Proven ability to handle confidential information with discretion, be adaptable to various competing demands, and demonstrate the highest level of client service and response.
‚Ä¢ Book smarts and street smarts
‚Ä¢ A strong desire to support the executive team and resilient enough to work at a early stage company

Before you apply, review these resources to better understand our culture and mission:
‚Ä¢ Rex ecosystem initiatives
‚Ä¢ Peter Rex writing in WSJ about moving Rex from Seattle to Austin
‚Ä¢ Peter Rex on Fox Business
‚Ä¢ Peter Rex on Bloomberg Radio

What we offer:
‚Ä¢ Competitive salary and early-in equity awards
‚Ä¢ Competitive and comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans
‚Ä¢ Peace of mind through company-paid short-term disability, long-term disability and life insurance
‚Ä¢ 401(K) with employer match
‚Ä¢ Unlimited (discretionary) PTO in addition to Holidays and your birthday off
‚Ä¢ Monthly gym membership stipend
‚Ä¢ Health Savings Account with employer contribution
‚Ä¢ Dependent Flexible Spending Account
‚Ä¢ Mental health telecounseling options
‚Ä¢ We are committed to serving others with a focus on faith, family, and freedom
‚Ä¢ Ability to work in person on hybrid schedule in Austin, Texas (or willing to relocate)

From the top-down, we are committed to investing in the development of all team members in both a professional and personal setting. We host monthly company socials where employees and family members get together to build our community. Regular performance evaluations are intended to provide a feedback loop, providing opportunities for consistent growth on both ends

title: Executive Assistant
description:

The Executive Assistant is responsible for providing high-level administrative support to senior level executives within the company, including but not limited to managing his/her schedule, travel, and expenses. The ideal candidate is highly organized, pragmatic, an expert multi-tasker and is not easily overwhelmed. Additionally, the Executive Assistant is comfortable... interfacing with all levels of internal management and staff as well as outside clients, vendors and candidates in a fast-paced environment. title: Executive Assistant
description:
Don‚Äôt wait. Anticipate. That‚Äôs the hallmark of a good executive assistant. But that‚Äôs not good enough for you. Because when you‚Äôre on the job, you‚Äôre a scheduling samurai, a disorganization destroyer, a problem-solver who proactively seeks out Murphy‚Äôs law and combats it with impeccable organization and risk mitigation strategies. You not only anticipate; you collaborate, accommodate, coordinate... communicate, and calculate what needs to get done on a daily basis with a rare combination of warmth, confidence, and efficiency that makes you the central nervous system of the executive suite.‚ÄØ

At Vital Farms, we‚Äôre looking for an Executive Assistant to the Senior Leadership Team who are not only passionate about their work and who strive for perfection, but who also see how their day-to-day efforts have the ability to create an impact on a much larger scale.

That‚Äôs because at Vital Farms, we‚Äôre on a mission to change the food industry one ethically sourced ingredient at a time. While we‚Äôre known for our pasture raised eggs - giving our hens 108 square feet to roam and calling bullsh*t on terms like cage free and free range - the truth is we‚Äôve got big plans to do so much more. That‚Äôs because we give a cluck when it comes to the health of our animals, the health of our customers, and the health of our planet.

If that sounds like something you care about, too, let‚Äôs talk about how you can be a force multiplier for goodness at Vital Farms as the Executive Assistant.

As someone with your level of experience, you understand that trust is at the heart of everything you do. Your exemplary time management skills, your attention to detail, and your ability to anticipate different scenarios is what ultimately builds trust with senior executives. You know that plans can (and often do) change at the last minute, which is why you always have a backup plan. And a backup plan for that backup plan. Calm, cool, and collected, you crave predictability (for yourself and for those around you) and you always have an eye for optimization.

Who We Are:
Vital Farms is a Certified B Corp that sources and markets delicious, high-quality, ethically-sourced egg and dairy products nationwide. We started on a single family-farm in Austin, TX in 2007, with 20 Rhode Island hens and a drive to raise the standards in sustainable agriculture. Today, Vital Farms is THE leading producer of pasture raised eggs, partnering with more than 275 family farms, and selling into over 18,000 grocery stores around the country. We believe that a healthy bottom line is the result of healthy business practices, and we care deeply about supporting all our stakeholders. This includes our crew, our consumers, our retailers, and of course our happy hens and contented cows. In short, we exist to improve the lives of people, animals, and our planet through food.

Next Steps:
Shortly after you complete your application, you'll receive a follow-up email elaborating on any potential next steps in our process. If you don't immediately receive said follow-up email, we would highly encourage you to check your spam filter!

In order to fulfill Vital Farms mission to ‚Äúbring ethically produced food to the table,‚Äù we seek to build teams that leverage diverse perspectives to create a welcoming and innovative environment that is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunities.

To that end, we make employment decisions based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Vital Farms does not discriminate on the basis of age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability or any other status protected by law

title: Executive Assistant, Austin
description:
Who We Are
Verkada is the leading physical security platform to protect people, assets and privacy. Designed with simplicity in mind, Verkada‚Äôs five product lines - video security cameras, access control, environmental sensors, alarms and visitor management - provide seamless visibility through an integrated secure cloud-based software platform. Over 9,700+ organizations worldwide trust Verkada... as their physical security layer for easier management, frictionless scalability and cutting-edge innovation.

About Verkada
At Verkada, we‚Äôre rethinking what it means to be physically safe. Today, we build security cameras that detect action, identify danger and help keep people and places safe and secure. Using a combination of software and hardware, we‚Äôre transforming an industry that has seen little innovation for decades‚Äîand we already support thousands of customers. But this is just the beginning. We envision a world in which security systems feel as seamless and modern as the organizations they protect and our enterprise solution becomes a model for not just business security, but public security as well. Verkada has raised over $150 million from backers including Sequoia Capital, First Round, Meritech, and Siemens.

Verkada is an equal opportunity employer. We strive to be a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. title: Management Assistant (Executive Assistant)
description:
Overview

When you join Hines, you will work alongside innovative leaders who set the standards responsible for our reputation as an industry leader today, and you'll be a part of shaping our future in the years to come...
Responsibilities

As a Management Assistant with Hines, you will be responsible for providing advanced administrative support to senior leadership to ensure the smooth operation of the area, under limited supervision. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
‚Ä¢ Process new contract acceptances, contract review, open escrow, send opening emails to internal and external teams, data input into excel spreadsheets for tracking, upload contract documents and wiring instructions.
‚Ä¢ Manage transaction timelines: Due Diligence, inspection period deadlines.
‚Ä¢ Prepare and send due diligence and closing date extensions, amendments, and extension.
‚Ä¢ Communicate efficiently with cross-functional teams, lenders, Title Companies to create a seamless transaction experience.
‚Ä¢ Track property status to ensure proper documentation is obtained prior to closing.
‚Ä¢ Proactively look for issues that could cause close delays and use problem-solving skills to resolve the issues.
‚Ä¢ Weekly/Monthly/Quarterly/reporting on lot sales, contract status and builder takedowns, heavy use of spreadsheets for linking and tracking.
‚Ä¢ Assist with due diligence process associated with acquisitions by performing document control, due diligence, developing underwriting assumptions, verifying, and establishing projections or other duties as assigned.
‚Ä¢ Participate in the management of existing projects including market research, analyzing builder home sales data, completing, and distributing project reporting requirements and administration of investor & bank requirements.
‚Ä¢ Monitor project budgets and schedules for significant variances. Work with Accounting team on financials and track by project.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate strong initiative and ability to work independently with minimal oversight.
‚Ä¢ Interact with employees, visitors and business partners with poise and diplomacy.
‚Ä¢ Ability to handle very stressful, high-pressured atmosphere.
‚Ä¢ Establish and maintain a cooperative working atmosphere among staff.
‚Ä¢ Ability to leverage technology and internet to perform all job functions at the highest level.
‚Ä¢ Provides administrative support by coordinating, facilitating, and communicating regional information.
‚Ä¢ Answers phones, forwards accurate and detailed messages, facilitates conference calls and, as appropriate, disseminates general information to callers.
‚Ä¢ Composes various documents such as agreements, contracts, correspondence, interoffice memos, presentations, and reports.
‚Ä¢ Coordinates special activities and functions such as Hines conferences, client conferences and special events, travel appearances, guest travel arrangements, meetings, interviews, and conference calls.
‚Ä¢ Plans for special and routine meetings and lunches, including coordinating conference space and schedules with other departments.
‚Ä¢ Makes comparisons between sets of data by identifying trends in data, drawing conclusions, and suggesting solutions.
‚Ä¢ Assists with presentations and special projects.
‚Ä¢ Establishes and maintains appropriate filing systems, both electronic and manual.
‚Ä¢ Creates, updates, and maintains departmental databases when appropriate.
Qualifications

Minimum Requirements include:
‚Ä¢ High School Diploma or equivalent from an accredited institution; College degree preferred.
‚Ä¢ Four or more years of experience in an executive administrative role in a professional office environment.
‚Ä¢ Experience working for a homebuilder a plus.

Closing

Hines is a privately owned global real estate investment firm founded in 1957 with a presence in 240 cities in 27 countries. Hines oversees a portfolio of assets under management valued at approximately $160.9 billion, including $81.7 billion in assets under management for which Hines serves as investment manager, and $79.2 billion representing more than 172.9 million square feet of assets for which Hines provides third-party property level services. Historically, Hines has developed, redeveloped or acquired approximately 1,450 properties, totaling over 485 million square feet. The firm has more than 180 developments currently underway around the world. With extensive experience in investments across the risk spectrum and all property types, and a pioneering commitment to ESG, Hines is one of the largest and most-respected real estate organizations in the world. Visit www.hines.com for more information. Includes both the global Hines organization as well as RIA AUM as of December 31, 2020.

We are an equal opportunity employer and support workforce diversity.

No calls or emails from third parties at this time please.

title: Executive Administrative Assistant - Austin/Round Rock Campus
description:
Description

SHIFT: No Weekends...

SCHEDULE: Full-time

Introduction

Galen College of Nursing is a vibrant and growing, single-purpose nursing college focused on expanding access to quality nursing education. Our culture is at the forefront of everything we do. Galen's fundamental goals are to be the best place for nursing education and the best place to work and one cannot be true without the other.

Benefits

At Galen College of Nursing, we want to ensure your needs are met. We offer a variety of comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plans along with some unique benefits including:
‚Ä¢ Tuition Reimbursement/Assistance Programs
‚Ä¢ Paid Personal Leave
‚Ä¢ 401k (100% annual match ‚Äì 3%-9% of pay based on years of service)
‚Ä¢ Identity Theft Protection discounts
‚Ä¢ Auto, Home, and Life Insurance options
‚Ä¢ Adoption Assistance
‚Ä¢ Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP)
‚Ä¢ Mental Health Coverage
‚Ä¢ Wellness Reimbursements
‚Ä¢ Annual Merit Increse Opportunities
‚Ä¢ Bonus Opportunities

Learn More About Employee Benefits

As you consider joining Galen, please carefully consider how you will model the culture we embrace and look to sustain. A culture where good ideas can come from anywhere and transparency is vital. Respect, accountability and integrity are non-negotiables, and commitment is created and sustained through the development of all employees. We care about each other and our students. We look for ways to exceed expectations and we are always looking for ways to improve and grow, while delivering the promise of extraordinary nursing education, matched only by a commitment to our students' success. If you feel our culture aligns with your strength of experience, attitude and authentic desire to work with great people to help changes lives, we'd love to talk!

Responsibilities

Position Overview Galen College of Nursing is looking for an Executive Administratrive Assistant to perform highly diversified administrative duties in support of the Program Directors.
‚Ä¢ Prepares internal and external presentations and print material, assisting in determining format and layout presentations. Maintains library of presentations.
‚Ä¢ Assists the Office for Academic Affairs in a variety of complex administrative duties involving contact and exposure to proprietary information. Utilizes independent judgment, determining when to act for management and when to refer problems for personal attention.
‚Ä¢ Makes preparations for Academic Affairs Council, Curriculum Council, and other meetings as assigned, including preparing agendas and supplemental documents, scheduling the conference space required, documenting meeting minutes, and facilitating refreshments.
‚Ä¢ Manages assigned calendars for the Office for Academic Affairs, responding to requests for time and rescheduling when necessary.
‚Ä¢ Makes appropriate travel reservations following College policy as needed.
‚Ä¢ Drafts and types non-routine letters, memos, documents, and various reports requiring knowledge of methods, procedures, policies, and organization for signature. This material may require familiarity with commonly used business and technical expressions used by assigned functions.
‚Ä¢ Screens incoming mail and faxes, categorizing and prioritizing response as needed. Prepares responses for signature, summmarizes lengthy correspondence, and follows up to ensure that proper and timely action is taken.
‚Ä¢ Prepares typewritten confidential correspondence, reports, meeting notices, presentation materials, and other documents in appropriate formats using word processing, spreadsheet, graphics, and/or desktop publishing software.
‚Ä¢ Provides accurate record and file maintenance. Filing systems include electronic and hard copy filing systems. Ensures filing is in proper format and filed in a timely manner.
‚Ä¢ Orders, prepares, and organizes equipment and supplies, as needed.
‚Ä¢ Other duties as assigned.

Qualifications
‚Ä¢ An earned associate's degree with appropriate technical knowledge or equivalent experience.
‚Ä¢ Special Qualifications: One (1) to three (3) years of project management experience.
‚Ä¢ Three (3) to five (5) years' experience in an administrative support role in a corporate environment.
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of Microsoft Office Products.
‚Ä¢ Must have excellent decision-making, problem-solving, and communication skills and the ability to take initiative and facilitate the college's efforts to achieve and maintain regional and nursing program accreditation.
‚Ä¢ Requires the ability to plan and organize and perform multiple tasks and responsibilities within established timelines.

Physical/Mental Demands and Work Environment: Position requires mental activity, reading, planning, preparing, evaluating, and decision making. Physical demands in classroom and office are minimal and considered sedentary work with occasional lifting and/or carrying such articles as records, files, and books (10 pounds maximum). Operation of standard office equipment such as phone, computer, classroom projector, Scantron, and printer/scanner, occurs on a frequent basis. Physical demands in the clinical area may include lifting, pulling, pushing, kneeling, stooping, crouching and bending or any other related activity.

Degree of Supervision: Minimal.

Galen College Values

Inclusivity: I foster an environment that provides opportunity for every individual to reach their full potential.

Character: I act with integrity and compassion in all I do.

Accountability: I own my role and accept responsibility for my actions.

Respect: I value every person as an individual with unique contributions worthy of consideration.

Excellence: I commit myself to the highest level of quality in everything I do.

At Galen College of Nursing, we offer a unique educational experience we call Pure Nursing. With a focus on nursing education, our knowledgeable and caring faculty and staff take personal interest in helping our students achieve their goals. Galen is regionally accredited by the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools Commission on Colleges (SACSCOC) to award Associate, Baccalaureate, and Master's Degrees. Our baccalaureate degree in nursing program is accredited by the Commission on Collegiate Nursing Education (CCNE), and the associate and master's degree in nursing programs are accredited by the Accreditation Commission for Education in Nursing (ACEN). For complete information related to Galen's accreditation status, please visit our website.

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Notice

Our Company's recruiters are here to help unlock the next possibility within your career and we take your candidate experience very seriously. During the recruitment process, no recruiter or employee will request financial or personal information (Social Security Number, credit card or bank information, etc.) from you via email. The recruiters will not email you from a public webmail client like Gmail or Yahoo Mail. If you feel suspicious of a job posting or job-related email, let us know by clicking here.

title: Executive Assistant/HR Coordinator
description:
Executive Assistant/HR CoordinatorSouth University Austin, TX, 1220 W. Louis Henna Boulevard, Round Rock, Texas, United States of AmericaReq #921 Sunday, October 24, 2021 What's next for you is the first priority for us! With over 45 programs from associate to doctoral degrees, South University is a private institution dedicated to providing educational opportunities that spark the intellectual... social and professional development of a diverse student population.

Our 120-year story-past, present and future-is a history formed by the many individuals who have developed the education and spirit of community that have become our pledge to the students, faculty, staff, alumni and supporters of South University. Online and at our 8 locations and 2 learning sites, we take pride in our welcoming environment; one-on-one support and personalized attention that helps students define goals and identify the means to pursue them. Our small classes feature hands-on experiences that not only shape students' skills and excellence in their chosen fields but also shape their characters through encouraging community involvement, volunteerism and the pursuit of life-long learning.

Visit www.southuniversity.edu today to learn more about what makes us stand apart as a place to
Belong, Believe and Become, a place where you can make a difference in the lives of students eager to learn and grow.

South University, the right direction for a brighter future.
