FSA/HSA

Tuition Assistant Program

Long/Short Term Disability

Life Insurance

Employee Assistance Program

401K Match

Generous Paid Time Off

12 Paid Holidays
‚Ä¢ includes domestic partner coverage

POSITION SUMMARY:

Under general supervision perform, coordinate and oversee office administrative duties in support of their assigned manager(s), including the provision of varied and complex office duties; may from time to time direct other support staff. This position requires the ability to act confidentially, handle sensitive information and exercise independent judgment. Some technical knowledge of the specific area of assignment may also be required.

KEY JOB ELEMENTS:
‚Ä¢ Answers telephones and directs inquiries to the assigned manager's office as appropriate. Greets office visitors and handles routine inquiries independently.
‚Ä¢ Performs administrative and clerical duties as assigned including travel arrangements. Maintains correspondence logs, files, information databases, and other tracking systems as necessary. Prepares Executive Committee, OPM, and other meeting minutes. Organizes meeting dates, meeting structure, and sends out agendas.
‚Ä¢ Orders supplies as necessary. Maintains office equipment such as fax machines, copy machines and printers. Tracks expenses for the same and submits for payment. Maintains contracts with vendors for equipment.
‚Ä¢ Prepares answers for routine correspondence for distribution over own signature and prepares correspondence for others signature.
‚Ä¢ Schedules all meetings as necessary including off-site and large group meetings. Makes travel arrangements for President and visitors as appropriate.
‚Ä¢ May complete State/Federal documents and surveys accurately and on time. Gathers information, completes documents and submits to reporting agencies.
‚Ä¢ On an annual basis, provides support for input of budget for the coming fiscal year.
‚Ä¢ Serves as the local HR coordinator.
‚Ä¢ Other duties as assigned. REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor's Degree in a related discipline. Minimum of four years' progressively more responsible administrative experience in a corporate or academic environment supporting mid to upper level manager(s). Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong interpersonal skills. Superior organizational and problem resolution skills. Business computing skills advanced proficiency level for Word, basic proficiency level for Excel, advanced proficiency level for Power Point, basic proficiency level for Outlook Ability to use database programs (i.e. Dayforce, Hyperion, CampusVue) Professional telephone manner and personal appearance. ENVIRONMENT:

The duties and characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The term "qualified individual with a disability" means an individual with a disability who, with or without reasonable accommodation, can perform the essential functions of the position. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to communicate professionally in person, over the telephone, through email and other electronic means, move about the office or school, handle various types of media and equipment, and visually or otherwise identify, observe and assess. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 10 pounds unless otherwise specified in the job description.

South University is an Equal Opportunity Employer and embraces diversity as a critical step in ensuring employee, student, and graduate success. We are committed to building and developing a diverse environment where a variety of ideas, cultures and perspectives can thrive.

title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
At Urology Austin, our mission is committed to improving the lives of patients and their families through compassionate, quality, and ethical care.

In choosing a career with Urology Austin, you are choosing to improve the lives of patients and their families through a collaborative team-driven approach in an innovative, quality-driven, community-based setting. Better Medicine. Better Care...

The Human Resources Assistant provides assistance with and facilitates the Human Resources processes at all business locations. This role administers employee health and welfare plans and acts as liaison between employees and insurance providers. This position resolves benefits-related problems and ensures effective use of plans and positive employee relations. The human resource coordinator makes that certain plans are administered in accordance with federal and state regulations and that plan provisions are followed. This role provides administrative support to the human resource function as needed, including record-keeping, file maintenance and HRIS entry.

ESSENTIAL SKILLS AND EXPERIENCES
‚Ä¢ High school diploma or equivalent required.
‚Ä¢ Administrative training required.
‚Ä¢ Two years of Human Resources assistance experience preferred.
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business Administration preferred.
‚Ä¢ Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
‚Ä¢ Extensive knowledge of office management systems and procedures.
‚Ä¢ Ability to operate general office equipment.
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
‚Ä¢ Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite or similar software.
‚Ä¢ Ability to maintain confidential information.

ESSENTIAL JOB RESPONSIBILITIES
‚Ä¢ Performs customer service functions by answering employee requests and questions.
‚Ä¢ Completes Forms I-9, verifies I-9 documentation and maintains I-9 files. Submits online investigation requests and assists with new-employee background checks.
‚Ä¢ Files documents into appropriate employee files.
‚Ä¢ Assists or prepares correspondence as requested.
‚Ä¢ Prepares new employee files.
‚Ä¢ Processes mail.
‚Ä¢ Assists with reconciling benefits statements.
‚Ä¢ Assists with processing of terminations.
‚Ä¢ Assists with the preparation of the performance review process.
‚Ä¢ Assists with recruitment and interview process. Tracks status of candidates in HRIS and responds with follow-up letters at the end of the recruiting process.
‚Ä¢ Schedules meetings and interviews as requested by the Human Resources Administrator.
‚Ä¢ Makes photocopies; mails, scans and emails documents; and performs other clerical functions.
‚Ä¢ Administers health and welfare plans, including enrollments, changes and terminations.
‚Ä¢ Processes required documents through payroll and insurance providers to ensure accurate record-keeping and proper deductions.
‚Ä¢ All other duties as assigned.

Urology Austin is an equal opportunity employer.

Urology Austin offers a competitive benefits package to eligible employees. Below are some of the benefits you may receive as an employee at Urology Austin.
‚Ä¢ Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
‚Ä¢ Short & Long Term Disability
‚Ä¢ 401(k) with Employer Contributions and Profit Sharing
‚Ä¢ Paid Time Off (PTO)
‚Ä¢ Group Term Life Insurance
‚Ä¢ Health Care & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts
‚Ä¢ Health Savings Account
‚Ä¢ Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
‚Ä¢ Competitive Wages
‚Ä¢ Paid Holidays, No Weekends

title: Senior Human Resources Administrative Assistant
description:
Job Description
MV Transportation is seeking an experience Senior Human Resources Administrative Assistant. A successful applicant will provide day-to-day human resources support in the following areas:

During the course of employment, employees may receive and have access to confidential information. All employees are expected to respect and maintain the confidentiality of non-public customer and business records and any other information that MV classifies as confidential.

MV Transportation is committed to as policy of Equal Employment Opportunity and will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin or ancestry, sex, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state or local laws, regulations or ordinances. title: CNA / Nursing Assistant - Now Hiring - Up to $20/hr - Offering...
description:
It's time to take control of your own career! When you join the ShiftMed team, you can browse through 100+ shifts from local nursing homes and skilled nursing facilities needing full-time and part-time Certified Nursing Assistants. Not only can you build your own schedule through ShiftMed, but you can get higher wages and benefits directly with us!

How to get started with ShiftMed...

1) Complete a brief application which includes your name, city, state, and zip to get started.

2) Download the app, create your account, and securely upload your documents for verification.

3) All shifts are available! Browse hundreds of shifts at local care providers to find the best match.

4) Get paid! You work as a full-time employee for ShiftMed when picking up shifts with us, not a contractor. Enjoy weekly pay at 20% more than local hourly rates.

Perks and Benefits:
‚Ä¢ Guaranteed Shifts (which means guaranteed pay!)
‚Ä¢ Competitive Pay
‚Ä¢ Flexible Contracts
‚Ä¢ Paid Sick Days
‚Ä¢ Overtime Pay
‚Ä¢ Full-time and Part-time Work
‚Ä¢ Next Day Pay! (no fee)
‚Ä¢ Direct Deposit
‚Ä¢ Self-Scheduled Shifts
‚Ä¢ 24/7 Team Support
‚Ä¢ Incentive Bonus Programs
‚Ä¢ Holiday Promotional Contests
‚Ä¢ And Much More!

ShiftMed Certified Nurse Aide (CNA) Requirements:

The primary role is to protect, sustain, and nurture the elders by providing assistance with activities of daily living and meeting other needs as required. Must truly have a desire to care for the elderly.
‚Ä¢ Must be mature and career-minded
‚Ä¢ Must have a Certified Nurse Aide (CNA) Certification for the state of employment
‚Ä¢ Must be able to push, pull, move and/or lift a minimum of 50 pounds to a minimum height of 3 feet.

Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Performs patients baths, oral hygiene, nail care, foot care, skincare, dressing, feeding, toileting and elimination, and transferring patient
‚Ä¢ Measures vital signs accurately
‚Ä¢ Notifies the Supervisory Nurse when a patient complains of pain
‚Ä¢ Positions patient in bed with proper body alignment
‚Ä¢ Assists patient with ambulation as necessary
‚Ä¢ Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety
‚Ä¢ Identifies and communicates abnormal findings to the Supervisory Nurse
‚Ä¢ Documents care rendered appropriately and timely
‚Ä¢ Reports to the selected facility and is prepared to work on time as scheduled
‚Ä¢ Adheres to facility standards as applicable
‚Ä¢ Wear Agency identification
‚Ä¢ Complies with Agency policies, procedures, and reporting requirements
‚Ä¢ The CNA must be able to fulfill all responsibilities and duties of the job description as posted

Apply today to join our CNA team, we look forward to virtually meeting you!

_____________

ShiftMed is committed to offering nurses a platform that helps them build a flexible schedule by bringing together hundreds of shifts to choose from. Rates offered may differ based on the location of assisted living, skilled nursing facilities, and hospitals that we've partnered up with. All advertised rates reflect the average wages ShiftMed's partner facilities are currently offering. Hourly rates fluctuate throughout each week and depending on the facility you schedule shifts with.

title: Data Analyst, Global Talent Selection
description:
Our team aims to ensure that Meta is finding and hiring the world's best talent. In this role, you will be responsible for providing accurate, reliable and accessible business metrics as well as contextualizing them in operational performance with research and advanced analysis. The Data Analyst will work closely with all roles within the Global Talent Selection team to improve and scale our... People Data work. The role will also liaise with various cross-functional partners across People Data teams and Data Engineer stakeholders to effectively organize and distill data, ask appropriate questions to understand hypotheses and requests, and present complex data in a compelling manner to an Executive audience. We are looking for Data Analysts who share our passion for building new functionality and improving existing systems. The candidate will be curious and inquisitive, have strong critical thinking and analytical skills, will thrive managing concurrent projects while working with a global team to drive outcomes and will enjoy informing and influencing stakeholders with data and insights. The candidate will also have the ability to build strong partnerships to drive impact across the organization.

Data Analyst, Global Talent Selection Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Build new analytics and reporting capabilities to support program evaluation and operations
‚Ä¢ Handle ad hoc reporting and analytics requests, while addressing stakeholder long-term needs and driving insights for Human Resource Partners and Executives using existing dashboard, Human Resource Information System (HRIS) data, and leveraging our people data ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Intake on business needs and apply contextual knowledge in order to scope data requests, synthesize insights, and recommend solutions to key business partners in collaboration with others
‚Ä¢ Effectively communicate with cross-functional partners and internal teams to deliver solutions in a timely fashion
‚Ä¢ Proactively manage stakeholder expectations, manage escalations and resolve issues in a timely manner
Minimum Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience working with SQL or relational database
‚Ä¢ 2+ years of experience with data visualization tools (e.g., ggplot2, Tableau)
‚Ä¢ Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a fast-paced and demanding environment
‚Ä¢ Experience having effective conversations with clients about their support needs and requirements, managing the intake process, and asking the right questions to scope and solve the requests
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data and business issues
Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Comfortable working in a fast-paced and demanding environment
‚Ä¢ Experience manipulating large data sets through object oriented programming (e.g., Python), statistical software (e.g., R) or other methods
‚Ä¢ Experience with R or Python for developing metrics or research variables
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of advanced visualization principles within a data presentation context (e.g., dashboards, presentation decks)
‚Ä¢ Experience working with HR/organizational people data preferred (e.g., selection/assessment, headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
‚Ä¢ Experience with data management, specifically with building data systems and validating reports from disparate systems

‚Ä¢ Experience initiating and driving projects to completion with minimal guidance
‚Ä¢ Experience working in a fast-paced and demanding environment
‚Ä¢ Experience having effective conversations with clients about their support needs and requirements, managing the intake process, and asking the right questions to scope and solve the requests
‚Ä¢ Demonstrated judgment and discretion when dealing with highly sensitive people data and business issues

Preferred Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Comfortable working in a fast-paced and demanding environment
‚Ä¢ Experience manipulating large data sets through object oriented programming (e.g., Python), statistical software (e.g., R) or other methods
‚Ä¢ Experience with R or Python for developing metrics or research variables
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of advanced visualization principles within a data presentation context (e.g., dashboards, presentation decks)
‚Ä¢ Experience working with HR/organizational people data preferred (e.g., selection/assessment, headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, and other people analytics)
‚Ä¢ Experience with data management, specifically with building data systems and validating reports from disparate systems

title: Space Data Analyst
description:
About JLL -

We're JLL-a leading professional services and investment management firm specializing in real estate. We have operations in over 80 countries and a workforce of over 91,000 individuals around the world who help real estate owners, occupiers and investors achieve their business ambitions. As a global Fortune 500 company, we also have an inherent responsibility to drive sustainability... and corporate social responsibility. That's why we're committed to our purpose to shape the future of real estate for a better world. We're using the most advanced technology to create rewarding opportunities, amazing spaces and sustainable real estate solutions for our clients, our people and our communities.

Our core values of teamwork, ethics and excellence are also fundamental to everything we do and we're honored to be recognized with awards for our success by organizations both globally and locally.

Creating a diverse and inclusive culture where we all feel welcomed, valued and empowered to achieve our full potential is important to who we are today and where we're headed in the future. And we know that unique backgrounds, experiences and perspectives help us think bigger, spark innovation and succeed together.

If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all of the requirements below. We're interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

We are looking for a Space Data Analyst for our Workplace & Occupancy Planning Team.

Key Responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Support planning, management, and workplace analysis across various strategic initiatives for a specific JLL client, in support of the Portfolio & Strategic planning team
‚Ä¢ Provide trend, business insights, opportunities, and recommendations based on advanced data analysis as it pertains to the holistic portfolio ecosystem
‚Ä¢ Effectively transform and communicate various streams of workplace data into insightful, understandable recommendations
‚Ä¢ Use available data resources to compile reports, request, and QA dashboards/databases
‚Ä¢ Collect and summarize data and understand what datasets are needed to help build and inform decisions
‚Ä¢ Deep understanding of the workplace needs of employees and various business groups
‚Ä¢ Work with cross-functional teams to collect and organize data with the ability to report findings clearly
‚Ä¢ Identify critical data sources and gather relevant information
‚Ä¢ Present to various stakeholders at different levels within the organization
‚Ä¢ Review and ensure that all analyses delivered are accurate and meet deadlines
‚Ä¢ Contribute new ideas and assist senior team members in the research and development of new data sets and dashboards
‚Ä¢ Build and maintain continuous reporting that highlights relevant business trends and opportunities for improvement
‚Ä¢ Build trusted relationships across all business lines and act as liaison
‚Ä¢ Perform ad-hoc projects, analytics and provide recommendations
‚Ä¢ Act as an aggregator for workplace planning activities, business insights, and portfolio data.
‚Ä¢ Knowledge where employee experience and workplace (space/place) come together
‚Ä¢ Build and present data that is tailored to specific audiences

Experience and Qualifications
‚Ä¢ Experience with data visualization tools (Tableau, Visier, etc)
‚Ä¢ Experience working with SQL
‚Ä¢ Experience working with IWMS/CAFM software applications (Archibus, Serraview, Tririga, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Experience with Data Management, specifically working with HR/organizational data and Real Estate space related data preferred
‚Ä¢ Ability to analyze qualitative and quantitative information and translate into strategic deliverables
‚Ä¢ Outstanding computer orientation and proficiency with Excel, PowerPoint and Word software is required
‚Ä¢ Self-motivating individual who is detail-oriented, has strong organizational skills, and the ability to work independently and within a team under deadlines
‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

#LI-MS

What you can expect from us

We succeed together and believe the best inspire the best, so we invest in supporting each other, learning together and celebrating our success.

Our Total Rewards program reflects our commitment to helping you achieve your career ambitions, recognizing your contributions, investing in your well-being and providing competitive benefits and pay.

We can't wait to see where your ambitions take you at JLL. Apply today!

JLL Privacy Notice

Jones Lang LaSalle (JLL), together with its subsidiaries and affiliates, is a leading global provider of real estate and investment management services. Generally the personal information we collect from you are for the purposes of processing in connection with JLL's recruitment process. title: Senior Data Analyst
description:
Our health system is broken, and it‚Äôs a huge problem. Costs are rising out of control while the patient experience gets worse. At Sana, we're passionate about fixing this problem by bringing accessible and affordable health plans to small and medium businesses. We've built an innovative team with top talent from across the health insurance and tech industries to create engaging, modern plans for... our clients. This allows our customers to offer competitive benefits packages while paying an average of 20% less than traditional plans.

Sana is looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join our small but growing data team. As a successful candidate you will perform product analysis, have opinions on and enjoy driving data governance, be an expert storyteller through visualizations, and perform detailed analysis of complex healthcare data that lead to improved cost, clinical, and business outcomes. You love to take on complex, data-driven questions that will directly influence key business decisions. You work well with key stakeholders to understand their problems and come up with balanced and scalable solutions to their problems.

You will collaborate across nearly all departments at Sana to deliver insights, analytics, and reports that empower stakeholders at Sana to make data-driven decisions that reduce uncertainties while providing an honest and balanced perspective to the questions being asked.

We are building a distributed data team and encourage all applicants to apply, regardless of location. We recognize that people may come from different backgrounds and experiences besides those listed on standard job applications. We strongly encourage you to apply even if you do not have an exact match to the experience requested but are interested in the work and the possibility of working at Sana. We are continually looking for new and diverse perspectives and people to join our teams!

We are agnostic as to the analysis tools used, but we use Tableau as our main business intelligence delivery tool. Expertise (or desire to learn) R, Python, or similar is expected.

About Sana
Sana is a modern health plan solution for small and medium businesses. We use a more efficient financing structure and integrated technology solutions to cut out wasteful spending and get members access to better quality care at lower cost. Founded in 2017, we are an experienced team of engineers, designers and health system operators. We have the financial backing of Silicon Valley venture firms and innovative reinsurance partners. If you are excited about building something new and being a part of fixing our broken healthcare system from the inside, please reach out

title: Data Analyst
description:
Why work at Entegris?

Lead. Inspire. Innovate. Define Your Future...

Not everyone who works for a global company shares the same background, experiences and perspectives. We leverage the differences of our employees to bring new ideas to the table. Every employee throughout the company is encouraged to share input on projects and initiatives. Our decision making process is truly a collaborative effort as we realize there are leaders at every level of the organization. We put our values at the core of how we operate as an organization ‚Äî not just when it‚Äôs convenient, but in a lasting and meaningful way. We want the time and energy you spend here to have a positive impact on your life inside and outside of the office.

Entegris is a values-driven culture and our employees rally around our core PACE values:

P eople

A ccountability

C reativity

E xcellence

The Role

We are seeking an enthusiastic, driven new college graduate to join our supply chain team! The ideal candidate will have a desire to apply their analytical skills to turn data into visibility that enables action. You will thrive in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment as you work hand-in-hand with Production Planning, Supply Network Planning, IT and Leadership of these teams. Come ‚Äòroll your sleeves up‚Äô and make a difference as you play a key role to help us achieve Operational Excellence!

In this role you will
‚Ä¢ Establish & maintain processes to collect, understand, cleanse and automate analysis of supply chain data efficiently derives business insight
‚Ä¢ Establish & maintain methods that enable data visualization to derive business insights and ‚Äòtells the story‚Äô
‚Ä¢ Use strong statistical knowledge to create trend identification & make predictions about supply chain related elements; needs to truly understand elements within the data that can‚Äôt be identified by the naked eye
‚Ä¢ Develop, and implement data models that significantly impact areas such as supply chain optimization, inventory optimization , manufacturing & distribution optimization, business strategy and more.

Traits we believe make a strong candidate
‚Ä¢ Bachelor‚Äôs degree Data Analytics or related discipline (Computer Science, Mathematics) with a minor or coursework in Supply Chain (Required); Master‚Äôs degree is a plus
‚Ä¢ Experience and comfort in working with large data sets and advanced skills related to use of Microsoft Excel
‚Ä¢ Education in and experience with advanced analytical techniques (e.g. machine learning, optimization, pattern recognition, cluster analysis, segmentation analysis, probability and statistics, time-series analysis, and predictive modeling etc.)
‚Ä¢ Education in and experience with data analysis tools and languages, (e.g. Python, R, etc.)
‚Ä¢ Education in and experience with experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)
‚Ä¢ Diligent attention to detail and strong technical intuition
‚Ä¢ Ability to translate business needs into advanced analytics solutions
‚Ä¢ Ability to communicate effectively in both extremes (technical side vs. business side)
‚Ä¢ Ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional environment
‚Ä¢ Ability to manage time and schedules to meet deadlines

Your success will be measured by
‚Ä¢ Obvious enthusiasm, initiative, and pride in work;
‚Ä¢ Accountability for results and respectfully & openly expresses ideas and viewpoints;
‚Ä¢ Leverages technical knowledge, process knowledge, tools and to solve problems and drive continuous improvement;
‚Ä¢ Never satisfied with the status quo;
‚Ä¢ Team-oriented mindset.

What we offer:

Our total rewards package goes above and beyond just a paycheck. Whether you‚Äôre looking to build your career, improve your health, or protect your wealth, we offer generous benefits to help you achieve your goals.
‚Ä¢ Very Competitive total compensation plans.
‚Ä¢ A 401(K) plan to help you plan for your future with an impressive employer match that‚Äôs all yours- no vesting!
‚Ä¢ Great health, dental and vision insurance packages to fit your needs to ensure you‚Äôre happy and healthy.
‚Ä¢ A progressive PTO policy that empowers our employees to take the time they need to recharge!

At Entegris we are committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants. Our policy is to recruit, hire, train, and reward employees for their individual abilities, achievements and experience without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, marital or military status.

Entegris strongly encourages all of its employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19. At Entegris, COVID-19 vaccination is preferred but not required at this time.

title: Staff Accountant - Class of 2022 (Fully Remote)
description:
We'd love to hear from you if you like:
‚Ä¢ Start-up energy - come join one of LinkedIn's Top 50 Tech Start-ups
‚Ä¢ Learning and solving interesting problems in a huge market ($800M market size...
‚Ä¢ Working closely with serial entrepreneurs and strong leaders who have scaled companies like Amazon, Facebook, Alibaba, Robinhood, SoFi, Microsoft, etc.
‚Ä¢ Meritocracy - we promote based on performance, not tenure

About the Opportunity:

If you are meticulous, have a passion for numbers, and looking to jumpstart your accounting career, then this is a unique opportunity for you to become a part of a hyper growth startup (Series C funding and 10X Revenue in 2021!). You will partner with our Head of Finance and senior leadership team to streamline and optimize our financial operations as we continue to scale.

Why Jerry:
‚Ä¢ Accelerated learning and Growth: 1 year at the right start up is the equivalent of 5-10 years at a larger company
‚Ä¢ High Impact: No one at Jerry is in a redundant role, your work will impact our entire organization
‚Ä¢ Mentorship: You will be working closely with proven leaders who have successfully scaled multi-billion dollar companies

Who you are:
‚Ä¢ Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance or related discipline
‚Ä¢ Internship, co-op or summer work experience in a related field
‚Ä¢ Involvement in extracurricular activities throughout your undergraduate program

How you will be contributing:
‚Ä¢ Own various transactional accounting responsibilities and play a key role in helping scale our financial capabilities
‚Ä¢ Ensure accurate coding and timely submission of expenses into the general ledger
‚Ä¢ Responsible for month-end closing activities, including balance sheet reconciliations, flux analysis and journal entries
‚Ä¢ Assist in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reporting
‚Ä¢ Liaise with internal teams to ensure a streamlined expense reporting process and think critically to improve operational efficiency
‚Ä¢ Assist with local, state and federal government reporting requirements and tax filings

What is it like to work at a hyper-growth tech startup for a new graduate?

Here is what a recent graduate said:

‚ÄúI joined Jerry less than 1 year ago. I have an Econ major and was not sure what role to apply to when I was graduating, but I knew I could get more opportunities and learn a ton by joining a startup. Jerry has wildly exceeded all my expectations. In less than 1 year, I have learned so much. All that I learned in a few months I feel would take years at another company. Really amazed by the mentorship and talented team members that I work with and learn from.‚Äù

About Jerry:

Jerry is building the first Super App to save car owners time and money on all their car expenses. Drivers deserve better. That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre committed to making shopping for insurance, financing, maintenance, repairs, parking and more just a few clicks, texts, or swipes away.

Jerry is taking processes that haven‚Äôt substantively changed in decades and reimagining and redesigning them. Using artificial intelligence, machine learning and bots, Jerry eliminates the need for long forms and phone calls while providing personalized services for all car-owners‚Äô needs.

Today, Jerry is the #1 rated and most downloaded app in its category and the fastest way to compare and buy car insurance. We have more than 1M customers and we are just getting started. Join our team of curious and passionate people who love tackling real-world problems and be a part of building a revolutionary product that‚Äôs disrupting a massive market.

Jerry was founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs and has raised more than $130 million in financing

title: Payroll Accountant
description:
Job Description

For more than a century, Ottobock has pursued the mission of helping people living with limb loss or mobility challenges regain or maintain their freedom of movement. We do this through the development of leading prosthetic, orthotic and wheelchair innovation and an unwavering commitment to delivering superior patient care experiences. As a growing healthcare company, we continue... to invest in both our people and new service offerings. With more than 8,000 employees worldwide and 1,100 across North America, we are dedicated to advancing the O&P industry and improving the lives of the people served by it.

We are looking for an experienced Payroll Accountant at our headquarters in Austin, TX. This position will be responsible for ensuring accurate and timely payroll processing for multiple company codes, preparing and processing multi-state payroll, time system auditing, payroll maintenance, and record keeping. Specific responsibilities and skill set includes but are not limited to:

Duties and Responsibilities:
‚Ä¢ Prepare accurate and timely biweekly and monthly multi-state payroll processing, ad-hoc manual checks as needed, and assist with troubleshooting errors.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for ADP payroll system set-up (i.e., accumulators, deductions codes, pay grids, state registrations, accruals) and modification as needed due to benefit changes, governmental and/or tax regulations, employee levies.
‚Ä¢ Manage Time and Attendance process which includes review of timecards for accuracy and working managers as needed. Work with HR/managers on system issues.
‚Ä¢ Resolve payroll discrepancies/complaints by collecting and analyzing information.
‚Ä¢ Perform analysis of payroll data for internal payroll and headcount reporting.
‚Ä¢ Maintain accuracy and resolves problems associated with benefits, W-2s, unemployment and withholding tax.
‚Ä¢ Maintain accurate records/reports/accruals for PTO and float time.
‚Ä¢ Assist in Workers Comp, 401K, and Finance audits as needed.
‚Ä¢ Responsible for benefit account funding, maintenance, reporting, and assisting HR Benefits team with annual audits.
‚Ä¢ Prepare and reconcile payroll journal entries and accruals for wages, taxes, PTO, bonus, benefits, etc.
‚Ä¢ May process employee expense reports based on company policy.
‚Ä¢ May be responsible for Concur system maintenance and training or assist as a backup.
‚Ä¢ Other duties and special projects as assigned.

Required Skills/Abilities:
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of payroll systems (ADP Workforce Now a plus).
‚Ä¢ Experience with multi-state payroll and related taxes (PA & CA a plus)
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of MS Office Suite and MS Teams.
‚Ä¢ Advanced Excel skills including use of Pivot Tables, VLOOKUP, and other moderate level functions.
‚Ä¢ Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks to completion.
‚Ä¢ Sharp attention to detail, very accurate, and highly organized.
‚Ä¢ Critical thinking and problem solving is essential.
‚Ä¢ Works well in a high volume, fast-paced, rapidly changing work environment.
‚Ä¢ Must be customer service focused and have pleasant demeanor with internal and external customers.
‚Ä¢ Ability to function independently in a multi-task environment and as a team.
‚Ä¢ Strong communicator in both written and verbal settings.

Education and Experience:
‚Ä¢ 2-year degree with accounting emphasis
‚Ä¢ 5-7 years of payroll experience with mid to large companies
‚Ä¢ Previous experience with ERP systems ‚Äì SAP R3 or BusinessOne is a plus

title: Staff Accountant
description:
Job Description

Community Impact Newspaper is seeking a Staff Accountant to oversee the accounting functions for our newspaper and affiliated companies. The Staff Accountant will have excellent analytical skills with thorough knowledge of accounting principles to analyze reports and forecasts. The ideal candidate forms relationships with all departments across the organization to strengthen... ability to cross-functionally solve problems.

We're looking for a candidate with knowledge and the following skills:
‚Ä¢ Strong attention to detail and good organizational skills
‚Ä¢ Ability to prioritize to meet deadlines with high degree of accuracy and minimal supervision
‚Ä¢ Demonstrates a solutions-oriented approach to resolving issues; innovates process improvements
‚Ä¢ Strong computer and Excel skills; experience with NetSuite and Adaptive Insights a plus but not required
‚Ä¢ Excellent written and verbal communication skills
‚Ä¢ Acts with integrity and creates an environment of trust and mutual respect
‚Ä¢ Flexibility in performing tasks outside of basic responsibilities
‚Ä¢ Visual and hearing acuity

Essential Job Functions:
‚Ä¢ Responsible for timely completion of assigned month-end close activities, including preparation of journal entries, calculation of accruals, reconciliation of balance sheet accounts and financial statement preparation
‚Ä¢ Maintain financial records for affiliated companies by analyzing balance sheets and general ledger accounts
‚Ä¢ Analyze and review accounting data for reasonableness and material errors
‚Ä¢ Perform monthly analysis of budget to actual variances, financial trends and outlooks
‚Ä¢ Assist with daily invoicing, accounts receivable and accounts payable
‚Ä¢ Strategically partner with the Sales and Print teams to price custom quotes and maximize margins
‚Ä¢ Own Sales and Use Tax Filings
‚Ä¢ Develop and document business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls
‚Ä¢ Complete special projects and other assignments from the Controller or CFO
‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with GAAP principles
‚Ä¢ Maintain positive working relationships with team and customers
‚Ä¢ Understand and adhere to the policies and procedures of Community Impact Newspaper

Minimum Qualifications:
‚Ä¢ Minimum Bachelors' degree in Accounting or related field
‚Ä¢ 2+ years accounting experience
‚Ä¢ Working knowledge of US GAAP

Who are we?

Community Impact Newspaper delivers 36 hyperlocal editions to more than 2.5 million homes throughout the Austin, Dallas, Houston, San Antonio and Phoenix and Nashville areas. Each of the markets we serve has its own dedicated editorial, sales and design staff, just like a small, traditional community newspaper.

But we're not small at all. We are a 200-person news enterprise that produces its own product 'our printing plant opened in 2016. Why are we so successful? We believe most people don't want right- or left-leaning news, just the news, and preferably from their own backyard. Since 2005, we have provided local, useful news without any ulterior motive or agenda. Community Impact Newspaper is privately owned by John and Jennifer Garrett

title: Front Desk Medical Receptionist

title: Medical Receptionist
description:

‚Ä¢... Gather patient demographic and insurance information to begin the scheduling process.

‚Ä¢ Maintain strict confidentiality of personal health information (PHI).
